header.title: Web Developer with a broad university degree

about.title: About me

paragraphs: My name is Cecilia Egevad and I have an extensive background in web development. I am also a licensed speech therapist and I am particularly passionate about making the web accessible to everyone.
I am now looking for new challenges where I can continue to grow as a developer. I am curious and enjoy a solution-focused approach, preferably in a team.

career_change.title: Career change from speech therapist to web developer
paragraphs: For several years I worked as a speech therapist in child and youth habilitation. In 2020, I decided to try something new and started taking courses in graphic design and programming. For example, I studied the following:

accessibility_course.title: Exciting course on digital accessibility
paragraphs: In 2021, I took a particularly rewarding course on digital accessibility – Universal design of digital accessibility. The course included both practical and theoretical elements in areas such as:

picture_self_portrait.figure_caption: Self-portrait in Illustrator from a graphic design course.

about.sep_paragraph: You can see examples of projects I have created in my portfolio:

university_exam.title: University degree in web development
paragraphs: After taking several courses, I wanted to wrap things up. In the fall of 2022, I therefore started the Webmaster program (120 credits) at University West.

The program is broad and includes everything from front-end and back-end to UX design. During the studies, I have, for example, created apps using React, Angular, and Vue, but also designed databases and created my own APIs.
My thesis was titled “Digital accessibility at Swedish public universities”. My partner and I conducted both manual and automatic accessibility testing at all public universities in Sweden.

current_studies.title: Fullstack - Ongoing Advanced Training
paragraphs: Since autumn 2024, I have been attending an advanced training program in fullstack development at Lexicon in Malmö. The program includes practical work on various projects, and from March to June 2025, I will have workplace-based learning (APL).
The program includes the following topics:
list: Backend (.NET fullstack, database methodology, Entity Framework, LINQ, ASP.NET Web, Azure & SQL in Microsoft SQL Server)
Methodology & tools (Agile & Scrum, Testing methodology, Cloud, Database concepts)

work_during_studies.title: Work during studies
paragraphs: Alongside my university studies, I have also learned a lot through the jobs I have had on the side. For example, I have worked with subtitling and accessibility adaptation of image and text material.
In the final year of my Webmaster studies, I also sat on the institution's program council as a student representative, which gave an interesting insight into the university's development work.

content.title: Graphic Design: Universal Design of Digital Accessibility
Graphic Design & Graphic Design for the Web

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.intro: Here is a selection of the projects I have created in recent years. Feel free to click on the links and check out the pages.

projects.title: World Facts – a flag app
description: The flag app is my first React app. The purpose was to create an app for a specific target group using a JavaScript framework and a REST API.
The flag app retrieves data via the REST Countries API. The app was designed for the target group "curious school children who want to learn more about flags".
The user can practice flags both by flipping flag cards and through a flag quiz.
During the development, I conducted user tests on the target group. Based on this, I clarified, for example, the feedback from the quiz by combining image and text.
projects.image_alt: The flag app is displayed on a tablet, a laptop, and a mobile phone.
projects.project_link_text: To the flag app World Facts

projects.title: Relaxguiden – Find Peace in Everyday Life
description: Relaxguiden is an app for those who quickly want to find a suitable video for relaxation. Filter the video list by type of relaxation, available time, and language to find what suits you best.
The app is built with React and styled with React Bootstrap and SCSS.
projects.image_alt: Relaxguiden displayed on a tablet, a laptop, and a mobile phone.

projects.title: Association Page with Full CRUD
description: The purpose of this project was to create a part of an association's website using PHP. I styled it with Bootstrap.
The requirements for the task were as follows:
list: The homepage should list the association's five upcoming activities. Only current activities should be fetched from the database

The website should have a password-protected admin page with two different permission levels. The administrator with the highest permission should be able to add, view, update, and delete activities (CRUD).
The page should be protected against SQL injections and have hashed passwords
projects.image_alt: The administration page and homepage of the website are displayed on two laptops.

projects.title: Birgitta's Blacksmithing – a SEO project
description: In this project, the purpose was to create a website for the fictional blacksmith Birgitta with a focus on search engine optimization (SEO).
My goal was primarily to create relevant content based on the intended target group and the company's values.
Most of the images on the page were created using Bing's AI tool Image Creator. However, I wrote the text myself. I also worked with, for example:
projects.image_alt: The Birgitta's Blacksmithing website is displayed on a tablet, a laptop, and a mobile phone.

projects.title: Ceci's Design – animation with jQuery
description: The purpose of this project was to create animations using jQuery. I added jQuery code to a simple sample page from a previous assignment.
My idea was to add subtle animation that does not distract the user unnecessarily.
projects.image_alt: The website is displayed on a tablet, a laptop, and a mobile phone.

projects.title: Munamii Cakery - a Tailwind Project
description: In this frontend project, the goal was to create a website for the company Munamii Cakery, which produces cupcakes and wedding cakes.
The app is built with React and styled with Tailwind. All images and texts on the site are AI-generated using various tools.
projects.image_alt: The Munamii Cakery website displayed on a tablet, a laptop, and a mobile phone.

projects.title: Portfolio Page
description: The purpose of this portfolio page is to present myself and what I have learned in recent years.
In the first step of the design process, I created a prototype in Figma. The illustrated images on the page were created earlier when I took a course in graphic design.
Based on the prototype in Figma, I then built the page in React.
projects.image_alt: The portfolio page is displayed on a tablet, a laptop, and a mobile phone.

picture_at.alt: Cecilia Egevad's logo is an at symbol that looks hand-drawn.
